meanings.definition: Not noble in character or quality.
meanings.sent1: The man's ignobler actions showed his lack of honor.
meanings.sent2: The old, torn clothes gave him an ignobler appearance.
meanings.sent3: It was quite ignobler of the cat to steal the dog's bed.
meanings.sent4: The weeds growing in the garden were the ignobler plants, overshadowing the roses.
meanings.sent5: The dark clouds cast an ignobler shadow over the once bright sky.

meanings.definition: Of low birth or common origin.
meanings.sent1: Her ignobler heritage was unknown to many in the village.
meanings.sent2: The humble cottage was a symbol of their ignobler beginnings.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel's antics in the tree were quite ignobler compared to the regal eagle's flight.
meanings.sent4: The ignobler roots of the tree spread far and wide, anchoring it firmly in the ground.
meanings.sent5: The ignobler origins of the town were evident in its simple, rustic architecture.
